charges.charge_description: 18:371.F CONSPIRACY TO DEFRAUD THE UNITED STATES-Defendants did knowingly and willfully conspire and agree together and with Michael Wilson, Quality Lake Fish, Michael Porter, Waterfresh Foods, Inc., Sheldon Kratchman, and Delaware Valley Fish Company (who are uncharged in this Indictment) and others known and unknown to the Grand Jury, to exchange in conduct involving the sale and purchase of fish with a market value in excess of $350.00 and to knowingly transport, sell, receive, acquire, or purchase in interstate commerce eels and/or walleye taken, purchased, transported, or sold in violation of New York State law and regulations, which is a violation of Title 16, U.S.C., Sections 3372(a)(2)(a) and 3373(d)(1)(B) (1)

18:371.F CONSPIRACY TO DEFRAUD THE UNITED STATES: Beginning on or before 1983, the exact date being unknown, and continuing up until the present, in the NDNY, the defendants did knowingly and wilfully conspire and agree together and w/Michael Wilson, Queality Lake Fish, Sheldon Kratchman, and Delaware Valley Fish Company, and w/others known and unknown to the Grand Jury, to accomplish the following: (1) to knowingly export and import fish, in violation of 16 U.S.C. 3372(a)(2)(A), knowing that the fish were taken, possessed, transported and sold in violation of NY law; (2) to knowingly sell or purchase fish w/a market value in excess of $350.00, in violation of 16 U.S.C. 3372(a)(2)(A), knowing that the fish were taken, possessed, transported and sold in violation of NY law; (3) to knowingly sell or purchase fish w/a market value greater than $350.00 or to knowingly import or export fish, for which a false record, account, or label for, or identification of, has been made or submitted, in violation of 16 U.S.C. 3372(d)(1) and (2). (1s)

charges.charge_disposition: term of imprisonment of 30 Months. Court recommends that Deft be designated to FCI McKean. Deft to Surrender 1/03/2000 by 2 p.m. Supervised Release term of 2 Years w/condition not to possess firearms. Special conditions to participate in alcohol and drug testing; submit to substance abuse evaluation and treatment w/costs of services; surrender commercial fishing license AND 3rd party notification requirements. Total Special Assessment $100.00.

charges.charge_description: 16:3373.F IMPORTS/EXPORTS FISH, WILDLIFE OR PLANTS-Defendants did knowingly engage in conduct that involved the sale and purchase of fish with a market value in excess of $350, and did knowingly transport, sell, receive, acquire, and purchase said fish in interstate commerce, knowing that they were taken, possessed, transported, and sold in violation of and in a manner inlawful under the laws and regulations of the State of New York. All in violation of Title 16, U.S.C., Sections 3372(a)(2)(A) and 3373(d)(1)(B), and Title 18, U.S.C., Section 2. (2-4)

16:3373.F IMPORTS/EXPORTS FISH, WILDLIFE OR PLANTS: On or about the dates set forth below, the exact dates unknown, w/in the NDNY and elsewhere, the defendants did knowingly engage in conduct that involved the sale and purchase of fish w/a market value in excess of $350, to wit: eel and/or walleye, and did knowingly, transport, sell, receive, acquire, and purchase said fish in interstate or foreign commerce, knowing that they were taken, possessed, transported, and sold in violation of and in a manner unlawful under the laws and regulations of the State of New York. Count 2: 1993; Count 3: 1994; Count 4: 1995. All in violation of 16 U.S.C. 3372(a)(2)(A) and 3373(d)(1)(A) and (B), and Title 18 U.S.C. 2. (2s-4s)

16:3373.F IMPORTS/EXPORTS FISH, WILDLIFE OR PLANTS-Defendants did knowingly engage in conduct that involved the sale and purchase of fish with a market value in excess of $350, and did knowigly transport, sell, receive, acquire, and purchase said fish in interstate commerce, knowing that they were taken, possessed, transported, and sold in violation of and in a manner unlawful under the laws and regulations of the State of New York. All in violation of Title 16, U.S.C., Sections 3372(a)(2)(A) and 3373(d)(1)(B) and Title 18, U.S.C., Section 2. (5-6)

16:3373.F IMPORTS/EXPORTS FISH, WILDLIFE OR PLANTS: On or about the dates set forth below, the exact dates unknown, w/in the NDNY and elsewhere, the defendants did knowingly engage in conduct that involved the sale and purchase of fish w/a market value in excess of $350.00, to wit: eel and/or walleye, and did knowingly, transport, sell, receive, acquire, and purchase said fish in interstate or foreign commerce, knowing that they were taken, possessed, transported, and sold in violation of and in a manner unlawful under the laws and regulations of the State of NY. Count 5: 1996; Count 6: 1997. All in violation of 16 U.S.C. 3372(a)(2)(A) and 3373(d)(1)(A) and (B), and 18 U.S.C. 2. (5s-6s)

16:3373.F IMPORTS/EXPORTS FISH, WILDLIFE OR PLANTS-Defendants, while involved in the offer of sale of, and intent to sell, fish with a market value greater than $350, did, knowingly make and submit, or cause to be made and submitted, one or more false record and account related to the monthly harvest of said fish, while intending to transport and having transported said fish in interstate commerce. In violation of Title 16, U.S.C., Sections 3372(d)(2) and 3373(d)(3)(A)(ii), and Title 18, U.S.C., Section 2 (7-11)

16:3373.F IMPORTS/EXPORTS FISH, WILDLIFE OR PLANTS: On or about the dates set forth below, the exact dates unknown, w/in the NDNY and elsewhere, the defendants while involved in the offer of sale of and intent to sell, fish w/a market value greater than $350, that is eel and/or walleye, did knowingly make and submit, or cause to be made and submitted, one or more false record, account, label and identification related to the harvest of fish, that is, false"Monthly Catch Reports,"for fish that were transported in interstate and foreign commerce. Count 7: 1993; Count 8: 1994; Count 9: 1995; Count 10: 1996; Count 11: 1997. In violation of 16 U.S.C. Sections 3372(d)(2) and 3373(d)(3)(A)(i) and (ii), and 18 U.S.C. 2. (7s-11s)

18:371.F CONSPIRACY TO DEFRAUD THE UNITED STATES-Defendants did knowingly and willfully conspire and agree together and with Michael Wilson, Quality Lake Fish, Michael Porter, Waterfresh Foods, Inc., Sheldon Kratchman, and Delaware Valley Fish Company (who are uncharged in this Indictment) and others known and unknown to the Grand Jury, to exchange in conduct involving the sale and purchase of fish with a market value in excess of $350.00 and to knowingly transport, sell, receive, acquire, or purchase in interstate commerce eels and/or walleye taken, purchased, transported, or sold in violation of New York State law and regulations, which is a violation of Title 16, U.S.C., Sections 3372(a)(2)(a) and 3373(d)(1)(B) (1)

18:371.F CONSPIRACY TO DEFRAUD THE UNITED STATES: Beginning on or before 1983, the exact date being unknown, and continuing up until the present, in the NDNY, the defendants did knowingly and wilfully conspire and agree together and w/Michael Wilson, Queality Lake Fish, Sheldon Kratchman, and Delaware Valley Fish Company, and w/others known and unknown to the Grand Jury, to accomplish the following: (1) to knowingly export and import fish, in violation of 16 U.S.C. 3372(a)(2)(A), knowing that the fish were taken, possessed, transported and sold in violation of NY law; (2) to knowingly sell or purchase fish w/a market value in excess of $350.00, in violation of 16 U.S.C. 3372(a)(2)(A), knowing that the fish were taken, possessed, transported and sold in violation of NY law; (3) to knowingly sell or purchase fish w/a market value greater than $350.00 or to knowingly import or export fish, for which a false record, account, or label for, or identification of, has been made or submitted, in violation of 16 U.S.C. 3372(d)(1) and (2). (1s)

charges.charge_disposition: imprisonment term of 37 Months. Surrender Date 12-07-99 by 2 p.m. Supervised Release term of 2 years w/condition not to possess firearms. Special Condition Deft shall surrender commercial fishing license AND the Deft shall notify 3rd parties of risks that may be occasiioned by his criminal record, etc. Total Special Assessment $100.00

charges.charge_description: 18:371.F CONSPIRACY TO DEFRAUD THE UNITED STATES: Beginning on or before 1983, the exact date being unknown, and continuing up until the present, in the NDNY, the defendants did knowingly and wilfully conspire and agree together and w/Michael Wilson, Queality Lake Fish, Sheldon Kratchman, and Delaware Valley Fish Company, and w/others known and unknown to the Grand Jury, to accomplish the following: (1) to knowingly export and import fish, in violation of 16 U.S.C. 3372(a)(2)(A), knowing that the fish were taken, possessed, transported and sold in violation of NY law; (2) to knowingly sell or purchase fish w/a market value in excess of $350.00, in violation of 16 U.S.C. 3372(a)(2)(A), knowing that the fish were taken, possessed, transported and sold in violation of NY law; (3) to knowingly sell or purchase fish w/a market value greater than $350.00 or to knowingly import or export fish, for which a false record, account, or label for, or identification of, has been made or submitted, in violation of 16 U.S.C. 3372(d)(1) and (2). charges.charge_disposition: Deft. Sentenced to 1 year and 1 day imprisonment; Deft. placed on supervised release for 2 years; Deft. to submit to substance abuse treatment/testing; Deft. shall not fish commercially in NY; Deft. to notify third parties of risks that may occasion by deft. criminal history; Deft. to pay $100.00 special assessment

charges.charge_disposition: term of imprisonment of 9 Months; Supervised Release term of 2 Years w/condition not to possess firearms; Special Condition that Deft shall not enter or attempt to enter the United States without permission; Total Special Assessment $100.00

charges.charge_description: 16:3373.F IMPORTS/EXPORTS FISH, WILDLIFE OR PLANTS: On or about the dates set forth below, the exact dates unknown, w/in the NDNY and elsewhere, the defendants did knowingly import or export fish or wildlife, to wit: eel and walleye, knowing that they were taken, possessed, transported and sold in violation of, or in a manner unlawful under the laws and regulations of the State of New York: Count 12-1995 (walleye only); Count 13-1996; Count 14-1997. In violation of Title 16 U.S.C. Sections 3372(a)(2)(A) and 3373(d)(1)(A), and Title 18 U.S.C. Section 2. (12-14)

16:3373.F IMPORTS/EXPORTS FISH, WILDLIFE OR PLANTS: On or about the dates set forth below, w/in the NDNY and elsewhere, the defendants while involved in the import, export, transport, sale, purchase or receipt of fish (eel) did knowingly make and submit, or cause to be made and submitted, one or more false record, account, label and identification related to said fish, that is, false customs declarations entitled"Canadian Customs Coding Form/Canada Customs Invoice", that failed to disclose the existence of the eel that were transported in foreign commerce. Count 15: [4/20/96]; Count 16: [4/22/96]; Count 17: [4/24/96]; Count 18: [4/27/96]; Count 19: [4/30/96]; Count 20: [5/7/96]; Count 21: [5/10/96]; Count 22: [5/13/96]. (15-22)

16:3373.F IMPORTS/EXPORTS FISH, WILDLIFE OR PLANTS: On or about the dates set forth below, w/in the NDNY and elsewhere, the defendants, while involved in the import, export, transport, sale, purchase or receipt of fish (eel) did knowingly make and submit, or cause to be made and submitted, one or more false record, account, label and identification related to said fish, that is, false customs declarations entltled"Canadian Customs Coding Form/Canada Customs Invoice,"that failed to disclose the existence of the eel that were transported in foreign commerce. Count 24: [5/21/96]; Count 25: [5/24/96]; Count 26: [10/18/96]; Count 27: [10/24/96]; Count 28: [5/2/97]; Count 29: [5/5/97]; Count 30: [5/7/97]; Count 31: [5/9/97]. In violation of 16 U.S.C. Sections 3372(d)(1) and (2) and 3373(d)(3)(A)(i). (24-31)

18:371.F CONSPIRACY TO DEFRAUD THE UNITED STATES: Beginning on or before 1983, the exact date being unknown, and continuing up until the present, in the NDNY and elsewhere, the defendants did knowingly and wilfully conspire and agree together and w/Michael Wilson, Quality Lake Fish, Sheldon Kratchman, and Delaware Valley Fish Co. and with others known and unknown to the Grand Jury to (1) knowingly export and import fish, in violation of 16 U.S.C. 3372(a)(2)(A), knowing that the fish were taken, possessed, transported and sold in violation of NY law; (2) knowingly sell or purchase fish w/a market value in excess of $350.00 in violation of 16 U.S.C. 3372(a)(2)(A), knowing that the fish were taken, possessed, transported and sold in violation of NY law; (3) knowingly sell or purchase fish w/a market value greater than $350.00, or to knowingly import or export fish, for which a false record, account, or label for, or identification of, has been made or submitted, in violation of 16 U.S.C. 3372(d)(1) and (2). (1)

charges.charge_disposition: Fine of $200,000 to be paid to the Clerk of the Court of the Canadian equivalent of $200,000, to be paid to the American funds in 5 installments over 5 years, with first payment due on 4-20-99, on the condition the Deft post a bond to insur e the fine payment. If the corporation fails to poas a bond, the total amount of the fine is due immediately to the Clerk of the Court; Total Special Assessment of $400.00 due immediately

Count 23: [5/16/96] (Waterfresh Only). (23)
